== About Me ==

I'm a self taught 3D artist, programmer and student of Computer Science faculty. I have an experience with a wide range of DCC S/W especially CG ones like Maya and Blender. I am working as a gameplay programmer at Cloud Mill Games. I am also interested in Graphics developing and everything Unixy and Geeky. I am an active member of the <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/EgyptTeam|Ubuntu-EG]]</nowiki> LoCo team.

== Involvement ==

=== Activities ===

* Gave a session about computer graphics using blender in an <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/EgyptTeam/Events/2010-05-08-LucidReleaseParty|Ubuntu Lucid Release party]]</nowiki> event. 

* Helped in the development of Cairo university Ubuntu course content.

* 2D and 3D Designing for the team <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/EgyptTeam/Artwork| Artwork page]]</nowiki>.

* Gave a lot of sessions about Ubuntu and FOSS in shrouck academy computer science department.

* Convinced my head of the department in computer science with <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Refaat|Ahmed Refaat]]</nowiki> to make Linux a case study of the OS course and other courses and to have a lab that is dedicated to that purpose with Ubuntu installed on its machines.

* Organized <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/872/detail/|Shrouck acadeny computer science department installfest]]</nowiki>.
*** My role was to get the event approved (<nowiki>[[https://docs.google.com/viewer?a=v&pid=explorer&chrome=true&srcid=0B_DS7E3EcHyMMjU2NjY5M2ItMTY4NC00ZmM5LWFmNDYtODcyNjNjOTdkZmUz&hl=en|my proposal]]</nowiki>) from the college and to coordinate with them for the event requirements.
*** Designed all necessary ads and banners for the event.
*** Gave 2 introductory sessions about <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/EgyptTeam/Presentations#Install-fest in Shrouck Academy|FOSS]]</nowiki>

* Supported and designed all the necessary <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/EgyptTeam/Artwork#Open Source Education Day 2011|designs]]</nowiki> for the Open Source Education Day 2011 in Misr University for Science and Technology.

* Participated in the booth in <nowiki>[[http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.201549413222847.55308.106059606105162|Cairo ICT]]</nowiki> event that Fixed Solutions gave part of it to us and design all the necessary designs for it. And contacting a lot of companies and organizations to know how ubuntu-eg can benefit from them. And also participate in writing our team report on it <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/EgyptTeam/Events/25-05-2011%20to%2028-05-2011%20Cairo%20ICT%202011%20Event%20Report|report link]]</nowiki>.

* Succeed to change a lot of people including my friends to use Ubuntu and convinced them with the open source philosophy.

* Attended all <nowiki>[[http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.191745664203222.47860.106059606105162|Ubuntu hour]]</nowiki> and global jam events with my LoCo team.

* Gave a GIMP session for iShare students at Cairo university.

* Member of <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/~egyptlocoteam|Egypt LoCo Launchpad team]]</nowiki>.

* Active in #ubuntu-eg IRC channel.

* Testing of several Open Source applications included in Ubuntu.

* Developing and maintaining an Open Source project <nowiki>[[http://www.3dvui.org|3D Virtual User Interface]]</nowiki>.

=== Future Goals ===

* Finish all scheduled Tasks On Time.

* Organize a workshop for Git reversion control system in Shrouck academy.

* Organize some courses in upper Egypt with <nowiki>[[www.4all-eg.org|4all organization]]</nowiki> which is a NGO that gives a lot of courses in upper Egypt.

* Contact <nowiki>[[http://http://alamrakamy.com/|Allam Rakmy Mgazine]]</nowiki> which is a weekly printed and e-magazine that we can publish a lot of articles in it. I actually contacted them in Cairo ICT but I need to send some content to them to be published.

* Contact <nowiki>[[http://www.arabhardware.net/|Arab Hardware Magazine]]</nowiki> which is an e-magazine which we can join them and have a free software an Ubuntu section it it.

* Make (I Open Source community) which is part of ubuntu-eg LoCo team as all of its members (about 7 core members till now) are members in the LoCo, an official Ubuntu community in my university.

* Get more people into the Ubuntu Egypt LoCo.

* Blender workshop in Cairo university under the name of Ubuntu-eg team.

* Participating in all events with Egypt LoCo team.

* Writing, Editing and Publishing monthly issue of the Ubuntu-eg magazine.

* Getting our team Ubuntu-eg approved.
